Summary Author analytic agenda for finance orgs, collaborate on next-gen search engine marketing (SEM), manage and grow finance talent, staff and compensate sales teams on quarterly and annual planning cycles & advise Google sales executives. Experience Lead Financial Analyst Google October 2014  – Present (11 months) - Architecting the technical agenda for the finance org that partners on ~a third of Google's annual revenue. 
- Dotted line management of four tiers of analysts -- mentoring them on projects, conducting career conversations, coaching them on technical and business expertise. 
- Interviewing external talent for junior, peer and senior staff-fills toward maintaining a strong bench in a constantly expanding opportunity universe. 
- Managing the sales quota compensation process end-to-end for the Americas impacting 2400 heads. Oversight of analysts who perform sophisticated forecasting and algorithm redesigns, keen partnering with engineering on automation and workflow UI, and negotiation of sales targets with all management tiers down from the Chief Business Officer. 
- Collaborating with economists, data scientists, product engineers and peer global finance orgs to craft the next generation of Google's search marketing solutions. Includes traveling globally to attend Google conferences, keeping up on the latest time series models to stay ahead of evolving user query trends and upskilling toward mastery of the search auction and its role in maximizing user and advertiser ROI. 
- Daily partnering with Google Sales VP with a $4B portfolio-- be a trusted advisor on advertiser segmention, optimal adoption of Google advertiser solutions and strategic team design toward future growth. Spearhead associated annual and quarterly planning cycles. Summary Barbara Arellano is a Financial Analyst at Google's Brand Finance team in Mountain View, California. Prior to joining Google, Ms. Arellano worked for Deloitte’s Analytics & Forensic Technology practice as a Data Analytics Senior Consultant and at Navigant Consulting as a Managing Technology Litigation Consultant. Her technical experience includes the analysis of relational data sets in Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft Access, and Oracle.  
 
Her industry experience has been primarily focused in the Financial Services sector including: global financial services, banking and securities, with broader industry experience across other industries including: pharmaceuticals, energy and information technology. 
 
Specialties: Financial modeling, SQL Server Management Studio, Data analytics and data mining especially in regard to corporate investigations, regulatory inquiries and business disputes.
